Definition:
Any dispute between employers and workers that is connected to the employment or non-employment, or the terms or conditions of employment of any person
(e.g. a dispute over pay or discrimination of a worker or group of workers)

Term: Secret ballot and one week’s notice
Definition: A secret ballot of members takes place: if the majority vote in favour of action, seven days’ notice of the strike is given to the employer
It is lawful to peacefully protest outside the workplace with placards (primary) or outside another workplace believed to be frustrating a resolution (secondary)
If action is official, employer cannot sue employees for any losses
